description: This file defines the interface for managing neighboring access point (AP) scanning in a network component. It includes function declarations for setting and getting various scanning parameters such as harvesting status, reporting periods, polling periods, and override time-to-live (TTL). It also contains validation functions for period values.

methods.name: SetNAPHarvestingStatus
methods.description: Sets the harvesting status for neighboring AP scans, enabling or disabling the feature.

methods.name: GetNAPHarvestingStatus
methods.description: Retrieves the current harvesting status for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: SetNAPReportingPeriod
methods.description: Sets the reporting period for neighboring AP scans in seconds.

methods.name: GetNAPReportingPeriod
methods.description: Retrieves the current reporting period for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: SetNAPPollingPeriod
methods.description: Sets the polling period for neighboring AP scans in seconds.

methods.name: GetNAPPollingPeriod
methods.description: Retrieves the current polling period for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: SetNAPReportingPeriodDefault
methods.description: Sets the default reporting period for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: GetNAPReportingPeriodDefault
methods.description: Retrieves the default reporting period for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: SetNAPPollingPeriodDefault
methods.description: Sets the default polling period for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: GetNAPPollingPeriodDefault
methods.description: Retrieves the default polling period for neighboring AP scans.

methods.name: GetNAPOverrideTTL
methods.description: Gets the timeout after which the NAP intervals return to default values.

methods.name: SetNAPOverrideTTL
methods.description: Sets the timeout for accelerated polling intervals during NAP scans.

methods.name: GetNAPOverrideTTLDefault
methods.description: Retrieves the default timeout for NAP scan override intervals.

methods.name: ValidateNAPPeriod
methods.description: Validates that the provided period is within the acceptable range of values.
